critique: This document approves a code of fair competition for the Reinforcing Materials Fabricating Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. It reflects President Roosevelt's interventionist approach during the New Deal era. The code aims to regulate the industry, indicating a move towards government intervention in the economy. The inclusion of a provision allowing the Administrator to review and modify actions taken by the board of directors suggests a strong federal oversight. There is no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The document centralizes power at the federal level through industry regulation.
